post.author: 강윤정

comment.author: 이성기
comment.content: Is this Websphere Test Environment in WSAD or standalone Websphere? then what is WAS version?

post.content:
I am in transition of my dev environment of Eclipse + Tomcat to WebSphere studio and server and have quite a bit of issues now.
Where does WebSphere store its loggging in case some "unexpected" exceptions happens within the deployed application?
WebSphere has its own log directory and some kind of file named as "...exception" seems to be the file keeping all kinds of errors that hadn't been caught by the application itself. But I cannot find any exception stack information or anything. Every exceptions I saw on that file was all IBM's own exceptions not my application.
Tomcat catches these unexpected errors and put them on its own log file so it is quite good spot to get a clue of what went wrong.
I'd like to find a similar log file in WebSphere but so far no luck..
post.title: WebSphere - how to see unexpected error?
